thread.title: Columbus school implements cell phone lock box to eliminate distractions and bullying
thread.title_full: Columbus school implements cell phone lock box to eliminate distractions and bullying

author: myfox28columbus.com
title: Columbus school implements cell phone lock box to eliminate distractions and bullying
text: {p}Some Columbus area schools are cracking down on student cell phone use during the school day.{/p}{p}The administration at North Columbus Preparatory Academy said cell phones are not only a distraction, but can potentially lead to criminal activity inside and outside school.{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-embed-file=\"1864708899485384949\" data-embed-type=\"twitter\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}\"The cell phone could really be used, in a sense, as a weapon to start instigating activities,\" the Dean of Students at North Columbus Prep Academy Justin Burwell said. \"It has been a trend that we have really wanted to focus in on stopping here.\"{br}{/p}{p}Each morning when students arrive at North Columbus Prep, they are asked to put their cell phones into a lockbox that is kept in Burwell's office throughout the day.{/p}{p}\"What we found is bullying takes place due to social media trends and negative behaviors have resulted from that, so we donâ€™t allow the phones in the classroom,\" North Coumbus Prep Academy Principal Ernest White said. \"We have had several cases where social media platforms were used to bully students.\"{/p}{p}Ernest and Burwell said if a student does not turn their phone in at the start of the day and is caught with it later, they will receive an automatic three-day suspension. iv%3E%20%3Cdiv%20style=%22background-color:%20#F4F4F4;%20border-radius:%2050%25;%20height:%2012.5px;%20width:%2012.5px;%20transform:%20translateX(9px)%20translateY(-18px);%22%3E%3C/div%3E%3C/div%3E%3Cdiv%20style=%22margin-left:%208px;%22%3E%20%3Cdiv%20style=%22%20background-color:%20#F4F4F4;%20border-radius:%2050%25;%20flex-grow:%200;%20height:%2020px;%20width:%2020px;%22%3E%3C/div%3E%20%3Cdiv%20style=%22%20width:%200;%20height:%200;%20border-top:%202px%20solid%20transparent;%20border-left:%206px%20solid%20#f4f4f4;%20border-bottom:%202px%20solid%20transparent;%20transform:%20translateX(16px)%20translateY(-4px)%20rotate(30deg)%22%3E%3C/div%3E%3C/div%3E%3Cdiv%20style=%22margin-left:%20auto;%22%3E%20%3Cdiv%20style=%22%20width:%200px;%20border-top:%208px%20solid%20#F4F4F4;%20border-right:%208px%20solid%20transparent;%20transform:%20translateY(16px);%22%3E%3C/div%3E%20%3Cdiv%20style=%22%20background-color:%20#F4F4F4;%20flex-grow:%200;%20height:%2012px;%20width:%2016px;%20transform:%20translateY(-4px);%22%3E%3C/div%3E%20%3Cdiv%20style=%22%20width:%200;%20height:%200;%20border-top:%208px%20solid%20#F4F4F4;%20border-left:%208px%20solid%20transparent;%20transform:%20translateY(-4px)%20translateX(8px);%22%3E%3C/div%3E%3C/div%3E%3C/div%3E%20%3Cdiv%20style=%22display:%20flex;%20flex-direction:%20column;%20flex-grow:%201;%20justify-content:%20center;%20margin-bottom:%2024px;%22%3E%20%3Cdiv%20style=%22%20background-color:%20#F4F4F4;%20border-radius:%204px;%20flex-grow:%200;%20height:%2014px;%20margin-bottom:%206px;%20width:%20224px;%22%3E%3C/div%3E%20%3Cdiv%20style=%22%20background-color:%20#F4F4F4;%20border-radius:%204px;%20flex-grow:%200;%20height:%2014px;%20width:%20144px;%22%3E%3C/div%3E%3C/div%3E%3C/a%3E%3Cp%20style=%22%20color:#c9c8cd;%20font-family:Arial,sans-serif;%20font-size:14px;%20line-height:17px;%20margin-bottom:0;%20margin-top:8px;%20overflow:hidden;%20padding:8px%200%207px;%20text-align:center;%20text-overflow:ellipsis;%20white-space:nowrap;%22%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.instagram.com/reel/DDNBhjruonP/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading%22%20style=%22%20color:#c9c8cd;%20font-family:Arial,sans-serif;%20font-size:14px;%20font-style:normal;%20font-weight:normal;%20line-height:17px;%20text-decoration:none;%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3EA%20post%20shared%20by%20ABC%206/FOX%2028%20(@wsyx6)%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/div%3E%3C/blockquote%3E%0A%3Cscript%20async%20src=%22//www.instagram.com/embed.js%22%3E%3C/script%3E%3C/div%3E\" data-embed-type=\"code\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}\"It can disrupt the classroom and is a distraction,\" White said. \"Kids videotaping one another, destroying property, physical altercations. So if we take it before they get in the building, that alleviates that process.\"{br}{/p}{p}According to the{a href=\"https://education.ohio.gov/Topics/Student-Supports/School-Wellness/Cell-Phones-in-Ohio-Schools\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://education.ohio.gov/Topics/Student-Supports/School-Wellness/Cell-Phones-in-Ohio-Schools\"} Ohio Department of Education and Workforce{/a} (DEW), the daily use of cell phones contributes to social deprivation, sleep deprivation, and attention fragmentation. For students, those harms may contribute to an increase in youth mental health concerns and have negative impacts on academic performance. {/p}{p}In the United States, 95% of teens ages 13-17 have access to smart cell phones, according to the DEW. Students, on average, receive 192 alerts per day from their cell phones, about 11 notifications per waking hour, one every five minutes.{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" 720,%22label%22:%22medium16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:648,%22url%22:%22/resources/media2/16x9/1280/648/center/90/a9a06a26-0591-4905-a43c-ee7482be6d1c-CellPhoneGraphic.png%22,%22width%22:1280,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:0,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%223c60a23f-2d66-4a75-9453-e16e68a6f89d%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22medium16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22medium16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22medium16x9%22%7D%7D\" data-thumburl=\"/resources/media2/16x9/1280/648/center/90/a9a06a26-0591-4905-a43c-ee7482be6d1c-CellPhoneGraphic.png\" data-title=\"Cell%20Phone%20Data\" data-url=\"\" data-defaultthumb=\"true\" data-embed-file=\"%0A%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-ImageEmbed%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cimg%20src=%22/resources/media2/16x9/1280/648/center/90/a9a06a26-0591-4905-a43c-ee7482be6d1c-CellPhoneGraphic.png%22%20alt=%22%22%20/%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-ImageEmbed-caption%22%3EColumbus%20school%20implements%20cell%20phone%20lock%20box%20(WSYX)%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E\" data-embed-type=\"image\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}In May, Governor Mike DeWine signed House Bill 250. The bill requires all schools to adopt a policy governing the use of cell phones by students by July 1, 2025.{/p}{p}On Thursday, the DEW released a report detailing the progress of school districts in creating and implementing policies on the use of cell phones in schools. According to the report, more than 60% of districts and community schools have already adopted policies this school year.
